intro: Odontostylis minor, commonly known as the small toothed grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the Poaceae family. It is a small, perennial grass that typically grows in wet or marshy environments. The plant has slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves. Its inflorescence consists of a single spikelet at the tip of each stem. Odontostylis minor is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
